intro: Primula elatior subvar. carpatica, commonly known as the Carpathian primrose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and violet, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of dark green, hairy leaves that help it retain moisture in its alpine habitat. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in meadows and forest edges. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and shady borders.
